snippet: Jihadists calling for mayhem at the Olympics — and Brazil’s relative inexperience in grappling with terrorism — has led to a sense of urgency in Rio....
abstract: Brazil is working closely with United States to help identify threats and thwart potential terrorist attacks at 2016 Olympics; American officials have been training Brazilian law enforcement and military personnel on how to deal with attacks involving biological or radiological materials, including how to identify less-guarded targets, and have brought dozens to US to observe how country manages security at high-profile public events.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Rukmini Callimachi contributed reporting from Stuttgart, Germany.

lead_paragraph: Jihadists calling for mayhem at the Olympics — and Brazil’s relative inexperience in grappling with terrorism — has led to a sense of urgency in Rio.

headline.main: As ISIS Posts in Portuguese, U.S. and Brazil Bolster Olympics Security
headline.print_headline: U.S. Helps Rio as Threats Rise Before Games
